You are a Dynamics 365 system functional consultant for a telecommunication firm.

You must configure and enable Agreements to ensure that work orders are automatically generated for customers who have contracted for that service, and that invoices are being sent at the correct intervals to the customers.

Which functions of the system support this requirement? To answer, drag the appropriate function to the appropriate scenario. Each function may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view the content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

choices.C: Schedule the using Resource Scheduling Optimization.
choices.A: Schedule by using drag and drop on the Schedule Board.
choices.B: Schedule by building a rule to automatically assign the customer-preferred resource.
choices.D: Schedule by using the Schedule Assistant.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Given the task - manually booking a resource that matches the customer’s specific requirements - the Schedule Assistant (Option D) stands out. It provides a shortlist of suitable resources based on the work order’s unique characteristics and time constraints, then lets you pick the best one. 

The drag-and-drop method (Option A) works too, but it requires you to manually sift through all resources on the Schedule Board, which could be less efficient, especially if there are many resources to consider.

Selected Answer: A
Drag and drop will not allow you to filter the resources based on the requirments.

Selected Answer: D
D is the best

questions.question_text:
You are a Microsoft Dynamics 365 Field Service dispatcher. A customer's work order has a particular characteristic and time requirement that is different from most other work orders.

You need to be shown the most suitable resources, and manually book the one that matches the customer’s requirements.

What should you do?

You recently created a new schedule board tab.

You need to ensure that only a subset of users can view this new tab.

Which two actions should you perform? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

comments.content: me too but 'or teams.' is not an option: just me, everyone, specific people.

discussion.content: I think this one should be A and B

Selected Answer: AB
Explanation:

A: To ensure only specific users can view the new tab, you need to configure the schedule board tab so that it is shared only with those people who should have access.

B: From the schedule board settings, you can control which users or teams can access the record by managing sharing settings.

The other options are not as directly related to the goal:

C: While emailing the link could notify users, it doesn’t manage access control or sharing permissions, so it doesn't directly address restricting viewership.

D: Having the proper security role is important, but this alone doesn't directly ensure access to a specific schedule board tab. You need to also handle sharing configurations.
Answer is A and B. When you go under Admin Settings > Advanced Find > Schedule Board Settings, you can share the schedule board settings with users and team.

However, when a schedule board tab is set to share with specific people, the specific people to share it with can't be modified from the tab settings. The actual Schedule Board Settings record needs to be shared with the specific people that require access.
This can initially be done by using Advanced Find and changing the look for field to be Schedule Board Settings table. When you select the results button, every schedule board tab that was created displays. Once you locate the schedule board you want to provide access to, select the share button, and the standard Dynamics 365 sharing screen displays.

comments.content: my understanding is you obviously share the new tab not with new users but with existing users who use the same functionalities as you are using. therefore, they all have the same role as you have. it is not usual to tell the users they should check the security roles of the users they want their stuff shared to prior to sharing. though ENSURE might be the keyword.

discussion.content: AD is good answer. You can only share with you, all or specific persons. No team proposed.

choices.A: Ensure the schedule board tab is configured to be shared with specific people.
choices.B: From the schedule board setting, ensure the record is shared with the appropriate users or teams.
choices.C: From the schedule board setting, email the record link to the appropriate users or teams.
choices.D: Ensure the users have the proper security role.

it is not about 'create work order' its about ENSURE. hence: Default Work Order Type: The work order type that applies to a work order when a user chooses this incident type.

You can add a default price list to a work order type. Incident types using that work order type also use the related price list, which saves time filling in price data.
